fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35853].
  {panel}

Ticket CONF-7526 has been open for the last 7 years.

It is very active: ever since I posted a comment about my own poor experience 3 weeks ago, there have been 8 additional comments, from 6 different complaining users - all for a 7-year-old ticket!
And all of them are complaining about a particular horrible piece of user experience within Confluence.

Depite all of these complaints, it appears that other than Atlassian users, nobody at Atlassian cares about this ticket. The most recent comment by an Atlassian employee was almost 4 years and 34 comments ago!

When are you guys going to at least stop ignoring your users who keep complaining about this? Please respect us by at least considering what your users keep complaining about for such a long time.
fields.summary: Atlassian support process has a long-standing ticket falling through the cracks
Invisible invocation code

h6. Steps to replicate

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35842].
  {panel}

Currently the following doc has a tag structure that can cause tags to be closed prematurely:

- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF54/Configuring+database+query+timeout

We instruct the following:
1.
{noformat}
<bean id="transactionManager" class="org.springframework.orm.hibernate.HibernateTransactionManager">
    <property name="sessionFactory">
        <ref bean="sessionFactory"/>
    </property>
    <property name="defaultTimeout" value="120"/>
</bean>
{noformat}

While the following changes need to take place:

2.
{code:xml}
    <bean id="transactionManager" class="org.springframework.orm.hibernate.HibernateTransactionManager" plugin:available="true">
        <property name="sessionFactory" ref="sessionFactory"/>
        <property name="defaultTimeout" value="120"/>
    </bean>
{code}
fields.summary: Update Documentation Regarding Query Timeout to Match Current XML structure

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35834].
  {panel}

It seems that Workbox can leak database connections when its rendering throws an exception. We have observed this on at least one of our cloud instances. The stack trace looks like this -

{noformat}
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.mywork.host.servlet.ServletRenderer.renderWithAnchor(ServletRenderer.java:54)
	at com.atlassian.mywork.host.servlet.ServletRenderer.renderWithAnchor(ServletRenderer.java:46)
	at com.atlassian.mywork.host.servlet.NotificationsMiniviewServlet.doGet(NotificationsMiniviewServlet.java:23)
	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:617)
	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:717)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.DelegatingPluginServlet.service(DelegatingPluginServlet.java:42)
	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:717)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.ServletModuleContainerServlet.service(ServletModuleContainerServlet.java:52)
	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:717)
	at 
<snip>
{noformat}

The GET request initiating this thread is {{/wiki/plugins/servlet/notifications-miniview}}
fields.summary: DB connection leak when Workbox requests (notifications-miniview) throw an exception

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35826].
{panel}
 
h3. Description 
We would like to be able to include a single field from a JIRA issue in a Confluence page.

A very similar question was asked on [Atlassian Community|https://community.atlassian.com/]:

- [Viewing single filelds of an issue in Confluence|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/viewing-single-fields-of-an-issue-in-Confluence/qaq-p/182751]

 

However, we need to be able to do this without resorting to Rest and JSON. Apparently it used to be an option in the JIRA Issues macro, but the functionality was removed. The enhancement could either be for it to be restored, or for a separate macro to be created.

h3. Workaround

Possible workaround discussed in below thread in [Atlassian Community|https://community.atlassian.com/]:
- [How to display Jira Issue field values in Confluence page|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-questions/How-to-display-Jira-Issue-field-values-in-Confluence-page/qaq-p/227374]

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35799].
  {panel}

*Bug Overview*

Confluence {{viewpowerpoint}} unable to render a powerpoint attachment successfully and the spinner never stop spinning. {{atlassian-confluence.log}} will reveal the following stack trace

{code}
2014-12-03 21:00:19,676 ERROR [DefaultSlideCacheManager:thread-1] [com.benryan.conversion.AbstractSlideConversionTask] call problem while converting noname.ppt
 -- url: /plugins/servlet/pptslide | userName: admin | referer: http://localhost:5440/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=2129922
org.apache.poi.poifs.filesystem.OfficeXmlFileException: The supplied data appears to be in the Office 2007+ XML. You are calling the part of POI that deals with OLE2 Office Documents. You need to call a different part of POI to process this data (eg XSSF instead of HSSF){code}

*Workaround*

In order to workaround this issue, it is necessary to disable PowerPoint attachment indexing. This means Confluence will not index the content of PowerPoint attachment, however the title of it will still be indexed and searchable.

# Go to *Confluence Admin* > *Manage Add-ons*.
# Toward the middle of the screen is a pulldown menu that says User Installed. Change it to All Add-ons. 
# Scroll down to *Office Connector* under *System Add-ons*
# Expand *Office Connector* plugin
# Click the + sign next to "*x of x modules enabled*"
# Disable the following modules:
#* Powerpoint 97 Content Extractor
#* Powerpoint 2007 Content Extractor

Currently there is no workaround for Cloud.
fields.summary: View Powerpoint Macro keep spinning

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35796].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
User mentioning is possible for any users on the instance, regardless of the page you are mentioning on. This causes a problem if you've mentioned someone but they don't have permissions to see the page, and so they won't see your comments. The user does not get any notifications.

h3. Suggested Solution
- Either show a warning that the user does not have permission to view the page
- Or only list the users that are able to view. First option is probably better.
fields.summary: Restrict mentions to users who have permission to view current page
The ability for some users to maintain user groups
Possibility to add parent page title in 'Create from template' macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35792].
  {panel}

h5. Summary
Create Page window is not showing any template, but a blank window instead when accessed through JIRA Agile's Planning mode

h5. Environment
JIRA 6.3.10, 6.3.12
Confluence 5.6.3, 565

h5. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a user (example: _test_) in JIRA that has the *Administer Projects* permission
# Create an application link between JIRA and Confluence
# Create a new user in Confluence with the same username and remove that user from any groups
# Give the user "Can Use" permission ONLY, in Confluence Global Permissions
# Ensure that there are no spaces in Confluence with Anonymous access permission, so that the user will be in read-only mode.
# Install JIRA Agile in JIRA
# Create a Scrum project
# Login as user _test_
# Click the *Linked Page > Create Page* button in Scrum's Plan mode

h5. Expected Results
User will be shown something like an error or _not permitted_ page. This is because anonymous users are not allowed to create contents in Confluence.

h5. Actual Results
Create Page dialog will pop-up, and the Loading icon will spin endlessly. The *Create* button seems to be missing as well.
!loading.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Throw a 'Not Permitted' message when creating a page on a Read-Only Confluence, through JIRA Agile Planning Mode

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35790].
  {panel}

To reproduce:

* download distribution from www.atlassian.com
* unpack targ.gz
* run bin/start-confluence.sh

I'd have expected an error message when first trying to access the instance, telling me that the home dir hasn't been set. The page displayed instead is not very helpful.

The error message is in the console log, but somewhat buried under the subsequent stacktraces.
fields.summary: Not setting the home dir on a fresh install leads to unhelpful error message
Link to comments at the head of pages
Confluence authentication support for Nginx

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35784].
  {panel}

Twice recently I have discovered that a user accidentally started a full space export. This can consume a lot of resources if the space is very large. We don't want to remove space export permissions, because being able to export a few pages is useful and is the only way, so far as I know, to export page comments. I would like to suggest improvements that would help prevent accidental full space exports.

Any or all of these improvements would help:
* Pop up a confirmation dialogue before starting a full space export (either a Normal export or a Custom export with all pages selected) to make sure that's really what the user wanted to do.
* Provide a configuration option to specify the maximum number of pages that can be exported using space export.
* Provide the ability for the user who started it or an admin to cancel a space export which is in progress.
fields.summary: Prevent accidental full space export
Ability to Trim Username From LDAP server

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35779].
  {panel}

*What is the current situation*
Only users that belong to the super user, {{confluence-administrators}} group has access to space admin throughout Confluence Instance.

*What is desired*
Users that has "confluence administrator" and "system administrator" rights from the Global Permission page are able to administer spaces within Confluence
fields.summary: Allow user that has System Administrator rights be able to administer space
Change the "System Administrator global permission able to administer space"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35774].
  {panel}

Customer would like to have the mentions user list sort alphabetically by first name then surname.
So for example if I have the following 4 users:
Laura Taitz
Laura Toll
Lauren Brand
Laura Brand

As I type 'Laur' I would expect the list to populate in this order:
Laura Brand
Lauren Brand
Laura Taitz
Laura Toll

When I continued typing 'Laura' I would expect the list to populate as such:
Laura Brand
Laura Taitz
Laura Toll

When I continued typing 'Laura T' I would expect the list to populate as such:
Laura Taitz
Laura Toll
fields.summary: Sort Mentions User List in Alphabetical Order

fields.summary: Typo in Online Doc

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35760].
  {panel}

*Background of The Request*

Customers might choose the option to use CONNECTOR method instead of DELEGATION as they want the group membership retrieval process and authentication into two processes instead of at the same time. Since CONNECTOR retrieve group membership using the LDAP synchronisation process, it is not necessary to retrieve the group membership during authentication process as well.

By forcing user membership retrieval during authentication process could cause performance issue during authentication process. Especially if customer is using SSL connection due to this [bug|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-35735]. This authentication performance issue will get worst if nested group membership is enabled.

*Propose Solution*

Provide an option for administrators to skip user membership retrieval during authentication in the directory configuration.
fields.summary: Provide an option to ignore group membership update during authentication for CONNECTOR

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35750].
  {panel}

Hi,

We are in the process of making sure OriginalTheme will be up to date with the 5.7 release. Right now we are testing agains the m22 version. We have some problems regarding the inline comments editor, the popup with the button does not show up when I highlight text. 

The cause of this seems to be that the area the highlighter looks in is selected using $(".wiki-content").first(), whereas we render content in multiple containers with that class-name.

We had a similar problem with the jira issue creator in confluence 5.4, and we received a javascript snippet (which let us specify another selector) to fix it that time. Could we get a similar fix for this, or do you have any other suggestions?

Best Regards,
Andreas
RefinedWiki
fields.summary: Inline comments compability issue with RefinedWiki OriginalTheme

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35740].
  {panel}

How to reproduce:
1) create 2 subpages attach multiple images to each page and label them with "page1" and "page2"
2) on the first page create a gallery that only includes images with "page1" label, on the second page only include images with "page2" label
3) create a page and include the 2 subpages with the include macro
4) on the rendere page click on one image in any of the galleries and you will be able to cycle through all images of all subpages
fields.summary: When including multiple subpages with galleries into a page the main page allows to cycle through all gallery images and not only through the ones defined in the subpages gallery

SQL Syntax Highlighting Does not Support Multiline Comments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35730].
  {panel}

h2. Problem summary
Since Confluence 5.4, it is possible create JIRA issues by highlighting text on a Confluence page. A dialog will pop-up over the highlighted text, with an option to create a comment from the quote, or to create an issue in JIRA.

However, we've observed instances where the Create JIRA option is missing (but the comment-from-quote option is still there) seemingly intermittently, without explicit change to the system from users or administrators.

h2. Troubleshooting
There can be more than one cause for this Create JIRA ticket option to not appear with text highlights:
* The plugin {{Confluence and Jira Content Connector}} might be disabled
* The plugin {{Page Highlight Actions}} might be disabled
* The individual user might have the "Show option panel when text is selected" setting unchecked in {{Profile > Settings}}

However, in the cases Support has observed, these avenues have already been explored. There are no errors in logs or in the UI, and the intermittent nature makes this issue particularly difficult to troubleshoot. The JIRA icon is simply missing when text is highlighted.

h2. Steps to reproduce
This issue is intermittent, and we do not have clear steps to reproduce. However, the problem appears to be with the in-memory cache.

h2. Workaround
We've found that the problem may be related to an in-memory cache store, and some customers have had success getting the functionality back by flushing the cache (via {{Confluence Admin > Cache Management (or Cache Statistics) > Flush all}}). Restarting Confluence may also restore the functionality.

ALSO:
Running a Content Index from Confluence administration >> Content indexing >> Rebuild, will clear this out.

(!) Confluence Cloud instances will need to file a support request at https://support.atlassian.com to request we run this for you due to permission restrictions on both flushing cache and content indexing.
fields.summary: Caching problems can cause the option to create JIRA Issue from highlighting text to become missing
syntax highlighter for R

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35727].
  {panel}

h3. ***Summary***
Previously, whenever a  PDF file is opened, in the previous Confluence version the customer would be prompted to download the file, but now there's a preview on screen. With the recent [update on Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/16+November+2014+to+21+November+2014#id-16November2014to21November2014-Confluence5.6-OD-37] users are forced to preview the PDF file.

h3. ***Improvement Request***
Customer's wants the ability to select whether or not to show the file in a preview mode.
 
A screenshot showing the actual behaviour.
!image.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Give the users the ability to select whether have or not the PDF preview mode on Confluence.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35723].
  {panel}

Once Confluence is on version 5.6.4 (or later versions), the following add-ons will be listed as incompatible with the next versions:


* Applinks Diagnostics Plugin: https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.applinks.applinks-diagnostics-plugin
* SSL for Confluence: https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.ssl
* Public Announcement Service: https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.pas
* IM Presence NG Plugin: https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/confluence.extra.impresence2

This is a request to update the version Matrix in Marketplace, so the users can use the plugins without reminders in the instance.
fields.summary: Update Matrix Version in Marketplace
Ability to change the background color in the Space List Macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35718].
  {panel}

Product Requirements Index Page (Or manually created by the Page Properties Report Macro (with label = requirements) has an ability to list the Product Requirements Pages within a Space. This is done by inserting the Space Keys in the second field, "Restrict to spaces". 

*What is suggested*:
Be able to *Restrict to Parent Page* instead of *Restricted to spaces*.

*Why*:
Would be useful should there be several projects within one Space. For example:
Space A has the following Child Pages: 
# Project 1
## Project 1 version 1.1
## Project 1 version 1.2
# Project 2
# Project 3.

Let's say each version of Project 1 has a Product Requirement Page. Therefore, it would be nice if there is a Product Requirements Index Page within the page "Project 1", that would list all the product requirements pages which is restricted to Project 1 only.
fields.summary: Be able to have the options to list Product Requirements Page within a Parent Page instead of a Space

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35717].
  {panel}

Background of The Request
At the moment there are no ways for user to create a page templates with child pages inside the template.

Examples:
User able to create a page hierarchy as below:
Page A
* Page A1
* Page A2
* Page A3

Page B
* Page B1
* Page B2
* Page B3
fields.summary: Able to Create page template with child page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35716].
  {panel}

Currently, the group can only be assigned by the Confluence Administrator. 

However, some organization that has high number of new user and volatile permission usage need a feature which allow the space admin to grant permission to their spaces to  a certain number of user.  It is not feasible to ask the administrator to make the changes and assign the user to the require group if the changes need to be done frequently. 

To illustrate this better, here's a  sample scenario:
# There is a group SPACE A
# Group A is allowed to view/edit the SPACE A
# User 11 is not a member of Group A
# User 11 try to access SPACE A
# User 11 is requested to join the Group A 
# User 11 provide the pass-code to signup
# User 11 is now added to the Group A and able to view and edit the pages in SPACE A
fields.summary: Allow user to signup into a group if they have the needed credential.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35714].
  {panel}

The *Confluence update check* feature on Confluence shows _bundled_ plugins as incompatible for new version as well, even though these plugins come along with the target Confluence installation.

The plugins are not compatible with the new version, indeed. However, since they are bundled plugins that come along with the target version, showing them as incompatible cause confusion to users that are planning to upgrade.

*Note:*
This only happens to those bundled plugins that were updated by the user.

*Steps to reproduce:*
# On a Confluence 5.4.4 for example, go under the _Confluence update check_ page
## Select _5.6.4_ under the _Check compatibility for update to:_ field
## Click on the _Check_ button
!img1.png|thumbnail!
# Now go to the _Manage add-ons_ page
!img2.png|thumbnail!
## Update the _Code Macro Plugin_
!img3.png|thumbnail!
# Go back to the _Confluence update check_ page and perform the first steps again
#* It will show the _Code Macro Plugin_ as _Incompatible_
!img4.png|thumbnail!

I've done this process with the _Support Tools Plugin_ as well:
!img5.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Update checker shows bundled plugin as incompatible
Provide a functionality to change an existing page to another blueprint layout

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35711].
  {panel}

h3. Reasoning:
When performing imports they can sometimes fail due to invalid characters in entities.xml. This requires manually stripping the characters (normally with a perl script) within the files and subsequently compressing them back. If the compression is done incorrectly (for example, a user compresses the containing directory and not the files themselves), the import then fails again due to being unable to find the exportDescriptor.properties file. This process (of fixing the entities.xml to remove invalid characters, compressing it, and then after it fails figuring out the correct way to compress the files) is extremely frustrating and time consuming for both customers and Atlassian Support.

h3. Specific Improvements:
- Strip invalid characters from entities.xml during import
- Look for export descriptor.properties recursively in the backup file (and not just in the top level)
fields.summary: XML Restore Improvements
Confluence Page Export to Include Encryption Option
Provide ability to totally disable the "Try other Atlassian apps" option in the Application Navigator

fields.description:

fields.summary: Allow comments within MS Word to be viewed within Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35699].

Good Morning,

I just have a quick question.  Why do our Confluence users seem to be off by one.  Meaning we see 25 and it lists 25 but when we try to make changes to Confluence it seems to say we are over the limit.  We have purchased 50 more recently, but I wanted to have Attlassian take a look to see if I am missing something or why this seems to be off by one.  If you could take a look and advise what may have caused this would be greatly appreciated.

Thank You,
Lester
Mobile Heartbeat
fields.summary: Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35696].
  {panel}

The current Quick search on Confluence has no background set in the CSS at the moment. When the header background is set to black (#000); the quick search bar background becomes black as well; making the Quick search bar 'disappear' from view.

In JIRA; there is a gray 'SEARCH' text to indicate the position of the quick search bar; but in Confluence there is none (causing it to disappear from view).

In the previous version of Confluence; the .aui-quicksearch (batch.css) has property background-color: #FFF. The recent Confluence has however seems to have removed this and replace it with background: none repeat scroll 0% 0% rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2); (which seems to have override background: none repeat scroll 0% 0% #F5F5F5; ) .

It might be better to change it back to the white/gray background so that it is more easily viewable.
fields.summary: Quicksearch bar on Confluence is missing background color attribute in CSS

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35695].
  {panel}

Example:
# GroupA has the following member:
#* GroupB
# GroupB has the following member:
#* UserA

Based on the above, UserA is the nested member of GroupA. GroupB is only a bridge used to link the nested membership between UserA and GroupA. It will be great if we have an option to hide GroupB (the subgroup) from all functions in Confluence, since some administrators will only be interested in GroupA. This creates a more organized UI, free from clutters of subgroups
fields.summary: Ability to hide subgroups in Nested Group relationships
(Atlassian Support Tools) Add Last Seen Timestamp to The Hercules Log Scanner
Add new PDF preview to Attachments macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35684].
  {panel}

We are currently using the Content by Label Macro for our Multi Project Management. So we can distinguish by status of the dimensions quality, costs, time, customer satisfaction, etc.

So what we would like to have is a bunch of labels we can choose from a dropdown, such as: on target, out of scope or critical. As well we want to show them on the confluence page as a status in order to have a good project overview for one project. We need the labels to have the overview for a few projects.

A quick example:

Quality - On Target (Status) - ontarget (label)
Costs - Critical (Status) - critical (label)
Time - On Target (Status) - ontarget (label)
Customer Satisfaction - Focus (Status) - focus (label)

Is there going to be a feature for this in the near future?
fields.summary: Possibilty to select a status (and label) from a dropdown

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35683].
  {panel}

When setting the colours of the theme to *Black*, the search box disappears in Confluence. 
!searchbox.jpeg!

In JIRA the word 'Search' is still visible.
!searchboxOK.jpeg!

*Note:* The Search Box is still available if the user clicks by the magnifying glass icon. It is just not visible as with every other theme colours

*Workaround:*
* Use a different colour like #333333 and the box will appear.
fields.summary: New Theme top bar colour on OnDemand doesn't show the Search box on black
Add * sign in the address field of share feature to show that it's mandatory
Google Apps OnDemand marketplace link is broken

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35678].
  {panel}

Problems:
- Vendor doc whose root URL changes
- The wiki URL is http://mywiki.domain.com, and someone puts http://mywiki in, the link still works (although it evades conversion to an internal link), searching for mywiki won't find these.

A couple of implementation ideas:
- Better search.
- A list of all web links for each space, alphabetized.

The first is better.
fields.summary: New way to find web links by their destination URLs

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35677].
  {panel}

At the moment the only mechanism is through the use of an api function via user macros, which counts all pages including all versions of pages and deleted pages (findPageTotal).

https://docs.atlassian.com/confluence/latest/com/atlassian/confluence/spaces/SpaceManager.html#findPageTotal%28com.atlassian.confluence.spaces.Space%29

Counting the number of pages in a space is an important piece of meta data.

Maybe have an additional parameter to specify what to count?
fields.summary: As an administrator I would like to have the ability to count the number of active pages in a given space
Create Children macro does not work in Chrome 38.0.2125.111 m
Export Space - add option to exclude all prior versions of the page (s)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35665].
  {panel}

h2. Example
There are a large number of documents in Confluence with the same word in the title.  For this example, we will use the word *Test*.  (example - *Test Page*, *Page Test*, *Test Now*, *Test Later*, etc).  

If the quotation marks are omitted, the document you are searching for (*Test Page*) won't appear in the results. We would like that the search engine would assume the results from quotes around the entire phrase *"Test"* had they have been there to be worth more than the results without quotes, but continue to include both sets of results.

This is an issue for larger instances that have many documents with similar titles.  We would like to see the exact results of the search appear first in the list and then non-exact results.
fields.summary: Search returns results that match exact term first

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35663].
  {panel}

HipChat keeps my team from using email like an instance message service and we love it.  We also love Confluence, but we've found one issue.  Comments are not posted to HipChat rooms even when linked.  I've even tried the other Hipchat add-on which adds support for comments, but it doesn't provided any details.  It just states:

comment on 'Page' in Space by User

It would be huge for use, if it also displayed the comment.  
And even better, if you could tie together the hip chat @usernames with the confluence @usernames.
fields.summary: As a confluence and hip chat user, I would like a pages comments to show up in a linked hip chat room, so that I'm notified live of new comments,
Automatically delete tasks that are finished for some time
Having an time estimation for the content index

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35656].
  {panel}

Here is an extremely common use case that is not covered properly by JIRA or Confluence user picket fields:
If you copy the email contact from an email client, like Microsoft Outlook, you will end-up with something like this in the clipboard: "John Doe <john.doe@acme.com>"
If you paste this value in the user picker, it will not find you the contact even if the username and the email address do both match perfectly.
If you paste only email address or only username it does work, but the entire idea is to make it work without having to edit the text.
I would even see it as an acceptable use to search only by email address if you paste a text formatted like the one above. The test above is the default format for email addresses, as in mail RFCs.
Think about this, is a minor code change that would increase user experience considerably.
fields.summary: Confluence user picker does not properly recognise email addresses with names
Slow page loading with number of comment using JIRA issue macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35651].
  {panel}

The Confluence Page Gadget height got resized after loading from different browser.

See below:
When adding gadget, the default size:
!Screen Shot 2014-11-17 at 2.27.49 PM.png|thumbnail!
(i) 266px X 493px

But log in using different browser:
!Screen Shot 2014-11-17 at 2.28.00 PM.png|thumbnail!
(i) 312px X 135 px

Tested in between different browser: Safari, Chrome and Firefox.

Steps to replicate:

# Create a Confluence Page Gadget on Dashboard
# Login using another browser
# Noticed the Confluence Page Gadget has been resized

Workaround:

No workaround as of now.
fields.summary: Confluence Page Gadget Height Truncated when View from Different Browser
